etymology.description: 阴道 + 炎 = inflammation of the vagina.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “vaginal inflammation,” a standard medical formation where 炎 functions like the -itis suffix. Indicates inflammatory conditions of the vaginal canal, regardless of cause.
etymology.simplification: Only 陰 was simplified to 阴 by reducing strokes in the right-side component; 道 and 炎 are unchanged. The form streamlines writing while preserving pronunciation and meaning.

examples.chinese: 她被诊断为阴道炎(她被診斷為陰道炎)。
医生建议她使用抗炎药并注意卫生(醫生建議她使用抗炎藥並注意衛生)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiànyì tā shǐyòng kàngyán yào bìng zhùyì wèishēng.
examples.english: The doctor advised her to use anti-inflammatory medicine and pay attention to hygiene.

examples.chinese: 若症状持续，应及时就医(若症狀持續，應及時就醫)。
examples.pinyin: Ruò zhèngzhuàng chíxù, yīng jíshí jiùyī.
examples.english: If symptoms persist, seek medical care promptly.
